requirements.summary: Add repeatable redeploy workflow for the existing VAANI testing build (no new project) with a safe retry path on failure.
acceptanceCriteria: A new deployment is completed for the existing VAANI project (not a new canister/app).
If a deployment error occurs, the deployment is retried and completes successfully.
The deployed app is reachable in a browser as a testing build.

file_operations.description: Create a redeploy helper script that runs the existing deploy command(s) for the current VAANI project and includes a simple retry-on-failure flow (re-run deploy after an error). Keep it non-destructive (no project initialization) and focused on redeploying the current draft.

Fill in the currently-empty 'Rebuild & Redeploy Commands' section with the exact commands used to redeploy the existing VAANI project and how to retry safely if the previous attempt errors, without initializing a new project.

requirements.summary: Update verification checklist to match the current provider hierarchy and ensure the header logo asset is present to avoid console/provider errors and asset 404s in the live testing build.
acceptanceCriteria: All checklist items in `frontend/DEPLOYMENT_VERIFICATION.md` can be confirmed in the live environment.
No provider-related console errors occur (e.g., "useAuth must be used within AuthProvider" / "useInternetIdentity must be used within InternetIdentityProvider").
No broken image/asset 404 errors occur for the header logo asset.

file_operations.description: Add the required generated header wordmark asset at the exact path `frontend/public/assets/generated/vaani-logo-header.dim_240x64.svg` so the live build does not 404 when loading the header logo.

Align the 'Provider Hierarchy Verification' section with the actual app wrapper order (as implemented in `frontend/src/main.tsx` and `frontend/src/App.tsx`), and ensure the checklist explicitly validates that `frontend/public/assets/generated/vaani-logo-header.dim_240x64.svg` is served without 404 and that provider-related console errors do not occur.
